author: Staff Reporter
text:
Students of Asian College of Journalism (ACJ) held a demonstration on their college campus on Friday to condemn the arrest of Jawaharlal Nehru University Student Union president Kanhaiya Kumar.

“Our question is: How many people can the authorities silence?” asked Devarsi Ghosh, a New Media student.

“A student who merely goes to college, reads the book and comes back home is treated with great respect, but the ones who question or is critical of what they see, are charged with sedition. We are in full support of the students at JNU and Kanhaiya Kumar,” he added.

Sashi Kumar, chairman, ACJ, said that the attack on journalists and students showed the length those in power would go to stifle freedom of speech.

Volunteers from the Revolutionary Youth Association (RYA) too held a protest in support of the JNU students’ struggle and also to condemn the ‘brutal’ attack on the media by some advocates, in front of Shastri Bhavan, Nungambakkam, on Friday. A. Kannan, secretary of the Association, spoke.
title: JNU issue: ACJ students protest
